title: Dozens arrested at WH as protesters call for end to Israel's response to Hamas attack
description: More than 30 people were arrested Monday at the White House, the Secret Service said, during protests by far-let Jewish groups calling for an end to the Israel-Hamas war

title: 4 inmates escape from a Georgia detention center, including murder suspect
description: Investigators in Georgia are asking for the public's help after four inmates escaped from a detention center early Monday morning.

title: Social media companies under scrutiny over false, violent posts amid Israel-Hamas war
description: European Union sent letters to platforms over possible content violations.

title: Huge turnout in Poland's decisive election, highest since 1919
description: Poles voted on Sunday in record numbers, nearly 74% -- the highest voter turnout in Poland since 1919.

title: Police in Belgium say 2 people have been killed in a shooting in Brussels
description: Belgian police say that two people are dead in central Brussels after several shots were fired

title: Arrest made in airport parking garage shooting that killed Philadelphia officer
description: Philadelphia police say they have made an arrest of a suspect in an airport parking garage shooting that killed one officer and wounded another last week

title: Flu, RSV starting to circulate but cases remain lower than last year: CDC
description: Flu and other respiratory viruses, like RSV, are starting to circulate but levels are not as high as they were this time last year, CDC data shows.

title: Biden admin reaches settlement with ACLU over separated migrant families under Trump
description: The Biden administration and the ACLU have reached a settlement that would provide relief for migrant families separated from their kids under the Trump administration

title: LinkedIn cuts more than 600 workers, about 3% of workforce
description: LinkedIn said Monday it is laying off hundreds of workers

title: Rite Aid files for bankruptcy amid growing debt, opioid complaints, lawsuits
description: Rite Aid filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Sunday and announced a new CEO as it takes on financial restructuring, legal complaints.

title: Ford executive chair gets involved in contract talks during uncommon presentation
description: Ford Motor Co. Executive Chairman Bill Ford called on autoworkers to come together and end a monthlong strike that he says could cost the company the ability to invest in the future

title: Supreme Court leaves in place court victory for PETA over North Carolina ag-gag law
description: The Supreme Court has rejected North Carolina’s appeal in a dispute with animal rights groups over a law aimed at preventing undercover employees at farms and other workplaces from taking documents or recording video

title: Inside Jerusalem's Old City, an eerie quiet: Reporter's Notebook
description: The steps of the Damascus Gate have been cleared out. Gone are the fruit and sumac vendors. And inside the Old City: rows and rows of shops have shut down.

title: WATCH:  Scenes of destruction inside Gaza refugee camp
description: Scenes from north Gaza's Jabalia refugee camp show destruction caused to buildings and streets following Israeli strikes on the enclave.

title: Palestinian recounts evacuating from Gaza while her brothers, father stayed behind
description: Following the 24-hour Gaza evacuation notice, Amel Safi said the women in her family and her youngest brother fled to Khan Yunis while the men stayed behind.

title: Biden postpones trip to Colorado as Israel-Hamas conflict intensifies
description: President Joe Biden has postponed a trip to Colorado to stay in Washington and focus on the growing conflict in the Middle East

title: Pfizer cuts full-year outlook due to declining sales of Covid-19-related products
description: Shares of Pfizer are falling before the opening bell as the company cut its full-year outlook, citing declining sales of its COVID-19-related products

title: Man, 71, charged with murder, hate crimes in stabbing death of 6-year-old
description: A 71-year-old man has been charged in the stabbing death of a 6-year-old boy on Saturday in the Chicago suburb of Plainfield, Illinois.

title: Hezbollah destroys Israeli surveillance cameras along the Lebanese border
description: Lebanon’s militant Hezbollah group said Monday it has started destroying surveillance cameras on several Israeli army posts along the border as tension rose following the Israel-Hamas war that began Oct.7

title: French authorities say school where teacher fatally stabbed evacuated over bomb alert
description: French authorities say a high school where a teacher was fatally stabbed in an attack last week has been evacuated over a bomb alert, as France’s president cut short travel plans abroad to host a security meeting Monday

title: Russia's FM to visit North Korea amid claims of weapons supplied to Moscow
description: Russia says its foreign minister will visit North Korea this week, days after the United States claimed Pyongyang has delivered munitions and military equipment to Russia for use in the fighting in Ukraine

title: Australian safety watchdog fines social platform X $385,000 for not tackling child abuse content
description: Australia’s online safety watchdog has fined X — the social media platform formerly known as Twitter — 610,500 Australian dollars ($385,000) for failing to fully explain how it tackled child sexual exploitation content

title: Major US pharmacy chain Rite Aid files for bankruptcy
description: Major U.S. pharmacy chain Rite Aid says it has filed for bankruptcy and obtained $3.45 billion in fresh financing as it carries out a restructuring plan while coping with falling sales and opioid-related lawsuits

title: Boyfriend arrested after Northern California sheriff's deputy found dead at her home
description: A Northern California sheriff’s deputy was found dead in her home.

title: Bills running back Damien Harris taken off field by ambulance
description: Buffalo Bills running back Damien Harris was taken off the football field by ambulance during Sunday night's game with the New York Giants.

title: 'Three's Company' actress Suzanne Somers dies at 76
description: Suzanne Somers, the actress best known for her roles in TV comedies including "Three's Company" and "Step by Step," has died, her longtime publicist announced.

title: UN aid chief says six months of war in Sudan has killed 9,000 people
description: It's created “one of the worst humanitarian nightmares in recent history."
